content:
First I am trying to install lean correctly. I have installed VS code and the lean4 extension. Then I executed lake init foo. But then I try to do lake build. The console gives an error.
←[1minfo: ←[0mdownloading component 'lean'
←[31m←[1merror: ←[0mbinary package was not provided for 'windows'
How can I solve this. Is it not possible to install it on windows?
Which instructions have you followed?

I was following https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathematics_in_lean/C01_Introduction.html#getting-started
In step 3 it said to follow those instructions. This links to https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/project.html#working-on-an-existing-project. Now I am trying to do Creating a Lean Project.
For the first two steps I installed the lean4 extensions and git was installed
OK so you've already followed https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/windows.html ?

Yes
I can make a lean file and it will eval #eval 18 + 19
I can use nat, disjunction etc. But I am missing some features I want such as \N instead of Nat and I cannot Open Nat or Open Set etc.
Does import Mathlib.Tactic fix this?
Mathlib is not a known package
Then your project is not set up properly. Did you create it with lake new MyProjectName math?
When I type import Mathlib.Tactic the Lean infoview gives unknown package 'Mathlib'
Kevin, you need to read the mangled error message he posted.
binary package was not provided for 'windows' is very bad

I tried to create one with lake new MyProjectName math but it gave
downloading component 'lean'
binary package was not provided for 'windows'
Alex, could you try running elan --version and tell us the output?
The output is elan 1.4.1 (6a7f30d8e 2022-04-15)
Aah
This is ancient.
elan self update and try again

thank you he is downloading self-updat now
I will let you know what happens if I try to setup the project again after the update

Okay it is working at the moment. He is downloading component 'lean'
Instead of giving the error binary package was not provided for 'windows'
Thank you for helping me I am now waiting for him to build all mathlib components. Do you know if you need to do this everytime you start your lean server of just once?
No no no!
You missed "run lake exe cache get" from https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/project.html#working-on-an-existing-project
Okay
You can escape safely and just run it now.
Thank you for your help I am gonna go for now.
alex van tilburg has marked this topic as resolved.
This topic was moved here from #lean4 > ✔ Trying to install lean4 with mathlib by Scott Morrison.
